0.name: Healthy
0.description: Leaf shows no visible nutrient deficiency symptoms.
0.recommendation: Maintain balanced fertilization and good agronomic practices.

1.name: Boron Deficiency
1.description: Deformed or brittle young leaves, poor flowering and fruit set.
1.recommendation: Apply boron-containing fertilizers such as borax in recommended doses.

2.name: Calcium Deficiency
2.description: Young leaves are distorted or hook-shaped, with necrotic tips.
2.recommendation: Apply agricultural lime or gypsum to improve calcium levels.

3.name: Iron Deficiency
3.description: Interveinal chlorosis on young leaves while veins remain green.
3.recommendation: Apply iron chelates or foliar sprays; ensure proper soil pH.

4.name: Magnesium Deficiency
4.description: Yellowing between veins on older leaves, veins remain green.
4.recommendation: Apply magnesium sulfate (Epsom salts) or dolomitic lime.

5.name: Manganese Deficiency
5.description: Interveinal chlorosis with small necrotic spots on young leaves.
5.recommendation: Apply manganese sulfate or foliar sprays.

6.name: Nitrogen Deficiency
6.description: Older leaves turn pale yellow starting from the tip.
6.recommendation: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizers such as urea or CAN.

7.name: Phosphorus Deficiency
7.description: Dark green foliage with purplish tinge, stunted growth.
7.recommendation: Apply phosphorus fertilizers such as DAP or rock phosphate.

8.name: Potassium Deficiency
8.description: Leaf edges turn brown and curl, plants more disease-prone.
8.recommendation: Apply muriate of potash (MOP) or potassium sulfate.
